issue.body:
### Issue URL (Ads) [https://music.youtube.com/watch?v=2xyRCZaiG1Y&list=RDATflc21vb3RoIGpheno](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fmusic.youtube.com%2Fwatch%3Fv%3D2xyRCZaiG1Y%26list%3DRDATflc21vb3RoIGpheno) ### Comment > AdGuard sometimes doesn't block ads, usually when you start a page you get ads, then after you manually block them, you're surprised that you can't see the videos, only the sound is heard. ### Screenshots

issue.title: www.twitch.tv

labels.name: Extra
labels.description: Issues, related to AdGuard Extra extension

labels.name: A: Problematic
labels.description: Issues, which cannot be resolved easily

issue.body:
This issue is known to be solved with [AdGuard Extra](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdGuardExtra) userscript.

If you’re using AdGuard for Windows, Mac or Android, please make sure that AdGuard Extra is enabled in the application settings.

If you’re using AdGuard Browser Extension, we suggest installing AdGuard Extra in addition to it.

* [Install for Chrome, Edge or other Chromium-based browsers](https://agrd.io/adguard_extra_chrome_release)
* [Install for Firefox](https://agrd.io/adguard_extra_firefox_release)

comment.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://www.twitch.tv/fragas](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.twitch.tv%2Ffragas) ### Comment > When ads come up and the blocking process begins, the screen goes black and stays that way permanently. I have to close my browser and start again. Everything is fine until ads come up again and the same thing occurs. Appears to happen with some streamers on twitch but not others. ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adtidy.org/sitereports/92gm8ysa3q4gksc0o0kosggkwskcwk0d70254pdts0.png?nc=1)
Screenshot 1 with AdGuard disabled ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adtidy.org/sitereports/8qav3g1ssqo0wos8oowkcocks0w0cgom3e1o0iqae8.png?nc=1)
### System configuration Information | Value --- | --- AdGuard product: | AdGuard Browser Extension v5.1.139 MV2 System version: | `Windows 11` Browser: | Edge Tracking protection: | disabled Filters: | Ad blocking:
AdGuard Base

Privacy:
AdGuard Tracking Protection

Social widgets:
AdGuard Social Media

Language-specific:
AdGuard German Browsing Security: | enabled Browsing Security statistics: | disabled Other extensions used: | `Bitdefender` ### Issue configuration [Import](https://reports.adguard.com/settings/import.html?product_type=ext&product_version=5.1.139&system_version=Windows+11&manifest_version=2&browser=edge&filters=2.3.4.6&userscripts_enabled=false&browsing_security_enabled=true&browsing_security_statistics_enabled=false&stealth.enabled=false&is_third_party_cookies=false&is_first_party_cookies=false&is_referrer=false&is_user_agent=false)
I updated the rule again. Let me know if this new one has any problems.

issue.title: www.hilton.com
issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://www.hilton.com/en/hilton-honors/](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.hilton.com%2Fen%2Fhilton-honors%2F) ### Comment > Chat in lower right is missing when AdGuard is enabled. This is the 3rd time this year this has happened and it keeps getting undone, is there a way to get this permanently fixed? ``` Username: @BranchS ``` ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adtidy.org/sitereports/9vvoxir9fmogc4kckwgsowgcksw4kwwd46eikxejzs.png?nc=1)
Screenshot 1 with AdGuard disabled ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adtidy.org/sitereports/9e783rlaqko4k44kggwgw48kk800so4t58gchsu5g0.png?nc=1)
### System configuration Information | Value --- | --- AdGuard product: | AdGuard for iOS v4.5.12 System version: | `iOS 18.6` License type: | free DNS filtering: | disabled Filters: | Ad blocking:
AdGuard Base,
AdGuard Mobile Ads

Privacy:
AdGuard Tracking Protection

Annoyances:
AdGuard Annoyances Other extensions used: | `None`

issue.title: www.youtube.com

labels.name: A: Problematic
labels.description: Issues, which cannot be resolved easily

issue.body:
# ATTENTION

> [!NOTE]  
> YouTube changes their detection scripts regularly. That means that sometime you can face the detection message.
> If all the following instructions do not work, please **email filters@adguard.com** or wait until any update is available. 

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use another adblocker in the same time because using another adblocker can delay/lags the YouTube loading (e.g., AdBlock Plus and AdBlock)[^1] OR interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use an userscript related to the bypassing YouTube detection message like [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing).
> Recently, YouTube anti-adblock script added infinite dummy advertisements to try to neutralize the userscript. ( [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing#264](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing/issues/264) )

> [!WARNING]
> Please check that there no another web browser extension that has adblocking feature is enabled on your web browser. It can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!IMPORTANT]  
> Saving memory feature of your web browser or sleep feature of your operating system can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.
> In this case, please re-enable AdGuard's filtering by toggling the protection toggle.
> Following the instructions can be needed.

### The instructions
1. Force to update the filters by clicking the reload button in AdGuard Browser Extension/AdGuard mobile or update tray menu in your system tray. [^2]
2. Reload the YouTube webpage without cache by pressing <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd> [^3].
3. Clear cache, cookies and site data of your web browser.
4. Re-open your web browser completely (checking your system monitor[^4] will be better).

[^1]: https://gitlab.com/adblockinc/ext/adblockplus/adblockplusui/-/issues/1576
[^2]: [AdGuard for Windows](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-windows/overview/#tray-menu); [AdGuard for Mac](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-mac/overview/#updates-check); 
[^3]: On macOS, <kbd>Command</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd>
[^4]: Task Manager on Windows, System Monitor on GNOME Shell, KDE System Guard on KDE Plasma or Activity Monitor on macOS. 


Previous issue https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/198973
